Player History
Drafted in 4th round, 61st overall pick, by Pittsburgh in 1973...
Injured on 6/8/1975 with a Strained Back Muscle, out for 3-4 weeks...
Injured on 6/28/1976 with a Bruised Hip, out for one week...
Injured on 6/26/1977 with a Fractured Wrist, out for 5-6 weeks...
Had first career hit (double) on 4/3/1980, off John Montefusco (PHI)...
Hit first career homerun on 4/6/1980, off Jim Bibby (PHI)...
Traded from Pittsburgh to Philadelphia on 6/23/1980 (Going to PIT: P J. Lamb. Going to PHI: C J. Quirk, 3B D. Baker)...
Injured on 8/25/1980 with a Hyper Extended Knee, out for 1-2 weeks...
Had 5 hits with 5 RBI against Chicago (N) on 8/15/1981...
